result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edwin Alfredo Camacho

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edwin Alfredo Camacho in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Edwin Alfredo Camacho.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised Defendant as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm/weapon and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea  Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum; received and filed.

Defendant Edwin Alfredo Camacho in court with attorney Amanda Kremer on behalf of Allison Marie Ritter.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Parties are still in negotiations and are requesting a PGP date. Case adjourned for a Plea Hearing to Br 16.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Amanda Kremer in court on behalf of Allison Marie Ritter.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendants appearance has been waived for the purpose of todays hearing. Court adjourns matter for an additional Status Conference date, due to reasons put forth on the record. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Edwin Alfredo Camacho in court, via zoom, with attorney Allison Marie Ritter. Patrick T. Franken appeared on behalf of John J. Rejowski for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Further, Defense advises that parties are still in negotiations and is requesting an additional scheduling date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edwin A Camacho in court with Attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be returned to the remitter.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Edwin A Camacho in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Initial Appearance scheduled for Thursday, March 31, 2022 at 1:00 p.m., in Room 221 of the Safety Building, 821 West State Street, Milwaukee,
Wisconsin 53233,
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/31/22 @ 1p
